abstract.p: Correction of October 13 Business Day article on resignations of two top officers at WebMD Inc

block.p: An article in Business Day on Friday about the resignations of two top officers at the WebMD Corporation referred imprecisely to the company's losses. Martin J. Wygod, who became sole chief executive, said the company had been losing more than $80 million every three months. That figure is a cash loss -- exclusive of good will and other accounting charges -- not a net loss. The second-quarter net loss was $906 million.
